User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Momentum application.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo. (Optional)

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

lastLoginAt.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user logged in.

settings.description: Settings associated with the user.  Example: theme, notifications

Habit.title: Habit
Habit.description: Represents a habit being tracked by a user.

color.description: Hex color code for the habit.

reminderTime.description: Time of day to send a reminder for the habit (HH:MM).

lastCompletedAt.description: Timestamp of the last time the habit was completed.

currentStreak.description: Current streak of consecutive days the habit has been completed.

longestStreak.description: Longest streak of consecutive days the habit has been completed.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the habit was created.

previousStreak.description: The streak count before the last completion, used for undo functionality.

previousLastCompletedAt.description: The completion timestamp before the last one, used for undo functionality.

Routine.title: Routine
Routine.description: Represents a routine consisting of a series of habits.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the routine was created.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task to be completed.

dueDate.description: Timestamp indicating when the task is due.

isCompleted.description: Indicates whether the task has been completed.

subtasks.description: List of subtasks associated with the task.

notes.description: Additional notes related to the task.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the task was created.

unit.description: Unit of measurement for the goal.

dueDate.description: Timestamp indicating when the goal is due.

isCompleted.description: Indicates whether the goal has been completed.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the goal was created.

progressHistory.description: History of progress towards the goal.

id.description: Unique identifier for the mood entry.

date.description: Timestamp indicating the date of the mood entry.

moodLabel.description: Text label for the mood level (e.g., 'Muy bien').

feelings.description: List of specific feelings associated with the mood entry.

influences.description: List of factors influencing the mood.

notes.description: Additional notes related to the mood entry.

date.description: Timestamp indicating the date of the transaction.

Budget.title: Budget
Budget.description: Represents a budget for a specific category.

currentSpend.description: Current amount spent in the budget category.

id.description: Unique identifier for the shopping list.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the shopping list was created.

items.description: List of items in the shopping list.

order.description: The order of the shopping list in the user's list.

PurchaseHistory.title: PurchaseHistory
PurchaseHistory.description: Represents the purchase history of a user for a given month.

id.description: Unique identifier for the purchase history record.

month.description: The month for which the purchase history is recorded (1-12).

year.description: The year for which the purchase history is recorded.

totalSpent.description: The total amount spent during the month.

purchaseDetails.description: JSON string containing details of each individual purchase during the month.

File.title: File
File.description: Represents a file stored on the server.

fileSize.description: Size of the file in bytes.

uploadDate.description: Timestamp indicating when the file was uploaded.

storageLocation.description: Location of the file in the storage system (e.g., URL).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure data isolation and efficient querying, leveraging subcollections for user-specific data and denormalization for authorization independence. The core principle is that all data related to a user is stored under their respective user document, fostering clear ownership and simplifies security rules. This approach avoids complex queries across collections and maintains data integrity. The design adheres to structural segregation by keeping data with similar access needs in the same collection.

Authorization Independence is achieved by storing all data belonging to a user under the `/users/{userId}` path. This allows security rules to be written based on `request.auth.uid` and the path, without needing to `get()` data from other documents.

The data structure supports required QAPs (Rules are not Filters) by employing path-based ownership and structural segregation, allowing secure `list` operations, so a user can only list documents under its user id, not other user's documents.
